intro: Chrysopsis brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegee's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, aiding in its dispersal. Chrysopsis brandegeei is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
